entries.title: Arsenal 0-0 Newcastle: Mikel Arteta says his side were denied two 'scandalous' penalties
entries.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says he is "really proud" of his side but they should have been awarded two penalties in their draw against Newcastle.

entries.title: Arsenal 0-0 Newcastle: Mikel Arteta unhappy after 'scandalous' penalty decisions
entries.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says his side being denied two penalties was "scandalous" after they drew 0-0 against Newcastle at Emirates Stadium.

entries.title: Manchester United 3-0 Bournemouth: Marcus Rashford scores again as Reds open up top-four cushion
entries.description: Marcus Rashford scores again as Manchester United stretched their winning run in all competitions to six games with a comfortable victory over Bournemouth.

entries.title: PDC World Championship: Michael Smith beats Michael van Gerwen in 2023 final
entries.description: Michael Smith wins the PDC World Championship for the first time, beating Michael van Gerwen 7-4 in a classic final.

entries.title: Sunak wants all pupils to study maths to 18
entries.description: The aim will feature in the PM's first speech of the year, which he will use to set out his priorities for 2023.

entries.title: Everton 1-4 Brighton & Hove Albion: Seagulls pile pressure on Frank Lampard with emphatic win
entries.description: Brighton pile the pressure on Everton manager Frank Lampard with an emphatic victory at Goodison Park.

entries.title: Arsenal 0-0 Newcastle United: Newcastle earn point against league-leaders Arsenal
entries.description: Newcastle United frustrate Premier League leaders Arsenal to earn a point with a dogged display at Emirates Stadium.

entries.title: Pele's funeral: Brazil legend given joyous send-off
entries.description: The footballing legend was laid to rest after a huge procession through the streets of Santos.

entries.title: European weather: Winter heat records smashed all over continent
entries.description: From Spain to Latvia, national and regional records for January are broken across the continent.

entries.title: Energy bill help for firms expected to be halved
entries.description: Gas and electricity prices have been fixed for firms until the end of March, but many want the support to continue.

entries.title: Sam Bankman-Fried pleads not guilty to fraud
entries.description: 'King of Crypto' Sam Bankman-Fried could face more than 100 years in prison if convicted.

entries.title: Aled Davies: Son of missing ex-BBC editor appeals for CCTV
entries.description: Aled Davies went missing on New Year's Eve and was last seen in Pontcanna, Cardiff.

entries.title: Iran's Revolutionary Guards set to be labelled as terrorist group by UK
entries.description: The legal move would make it a UK criminal office to belong to, or support, the paramilitary group.

entries.title: Mark Cavendish: Robbery at Essex home was 'planned invasion'
entries.description: Prosecutors say robbers threatened to stab the Olympic cyclist in front of his three-year-old son.

entries.title: Makiivka: Russia points fingers after deadliest Ukraine attack
entries.description: The deaths of dozens of Russian soldiers at Makiivka in Ukraine prompt recriminations in Russia.

entries.title: China Covid: Beijing criticises 'political' rules for its tourists
entries.description: As China opens its borders, countries around the world have announced testing for arrivals.

entries.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: New Al Nassr signing had 'many opportunities' to join top clubs
entries.description: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo says he had "many opportunities" to join top clubs before signing for Saudi Arabia side Al Nassr.

entries.title: Breast cancer patients take part in proton beam trial
entries.description: UK scientists are assessing if certain patients with heart problems would benefit from it over radiotherapy.

entries.title: Strike daily: How Wednesday 4 January’s walkouts will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about the rail strike and other strike action this week, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Pele's funeral: Thousands line streets of Santos as Brazil football legend is laid to rest
entries.description: Thousands of mourners line the streets as Brazilian football icon Pele is laid to rest in Santos, the city of his former club.

entries.title: Brazil says final goodbye to Pele on his last journey
entries.description: A procession carrying Pelé's coffin passed through the streets of Santos, before a private family burial.

entries.title: Pair charged with illegally aborting baby in Gloucestershire
entries.description: Elliot Benham and Sophie Harvey, both 23, are also accused of concealing the birth of a child.

entries.title: Kelly Monteith: US comic who had own UK show dies at 80
entries.description: The US stand-up comic had his own BBC TV series in the late 1970s and early 1980s.

entries.title: Scarborough Hospital patient sleeps in car due to bed shortage
entries.description: Michael Woodcock, suffering appendicitis, says he would have otherwise had to sleep in a chair.

entries.title: Eleanor Williams: The grooming gang lies that sparked outrage

entries.title: Eleanor Williams: Woman guilty of false rape claims

entries.title: TikTok teenage beauty queen sees account blocked over acne

entries.title: De La Soul: Classic back catalogue finally available for streaming

entries.title: Enzo Fernandez: Chelsea in talks with Benfica over Argentina midfielder
entries.description: Chelsea are continuing talks with Benfica about signing Argentina's World Cup-winning midfielder Enzo Fernandez.

entries.title: Rhianan Rudd: MI5 had evidence teen terror suspect was exploited
entries.description: The girl, who took her own life, should have been seen as a victim not a terrorist, her mum says.

entries.title: First migrants of 2023 cross Channel in small boat

entries.title: MP Virginia Crosbie wears stab vest to meet constituents

entries.title: UFC president Dana White and wife sorry after hitting each other in Mexico

entries.title: Saqib Mahmood set for return on England Lions tour to Sri Lanka

entries.title: Murder arrest after man in care fatally assaulted in Hayes
entries.description: Another resident of the west London care home is arrested on suspicion of murder.

entries.title: Wearing a mask if ill is sensible advice - minister

entries.title: Siya Kolisi: South Africa captain to join Racing 92 after World Cup

entries.title: Thor the walrus leaves Blyth after overnight harbour stay
entries.description: Thor attracted huge crowds in Scarborough before spending an afternoon and night in Blyth

entries.description: A young woman's death in a gruesome manner has sparked outrage in India's national capital.

entries.title: César film awards ban nominees investigated for sexual violence

entries.title: Waterloo Road: Why BBC school drama is back after eight-year break

entries.title: Cuba: Women boxers allowed to compete after rule change
